intro: A source of clear, trusted, shareable information about COVID and the available vaccines to help you make informed decisions about how to protect yourself and curb transmission. We offer essential resources to help you understand, interpret, and apply Covid Act Now’s data.
metadataDescription: Find recent and trusted information & resources about the novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV). Learn about Symptoms, Tests, Risks, and more. Backed by medical experts. Make informed decisions to stop the disease for you and your community.

sections.description: Learn about the key metrics Covid Act Now uses to assess COVID across U.S. states, metros, and counties.

Here are answers to some of the most common COVID questions such as: Are COVID vaccines safe? Should you get a vaccine if you've already had COVID? How soon after possible exposure to COVID should you get tested?
Access our archive of short, digestible summaries of significant scientific literature and COVID research over the course of 2020 to 2021.
Antigen test vs PCR test. Here you can find clear definitions of the vocabulary being used to talk about COVID.

Our archive of articles containing facts about how COVID is spread, how to prevent transmission, and the latest on treatments and vaccines, written by scientists, researchers and public health experts.
Learn about how leaders in industry, public health, and government are using Covid Act Now’s data and tools in their strategic pandemic response to make better decisions to combat COVID.

editorsNote: **A note on our editorial policy:** To bring you the most accurate, up-to-date information and advice about COVID, Covid Act Now’s editorial team relies on established, scientific sources, including academic and medical research institutions, professional medical associations, and governmental health agencies. We review the latest scientific literature on COVID and include links to primary studies. Our global understanding of COVID is evolving rapidly, and we note when there are limitations in studies.
